basics.name: Damiano Franzò
basics.label: Postdoctoral fellow
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher actively engaged in computational electromagnetics at Politecnico di Torino. Conducting research activity to explore both theoretical and numerical aspects, with a particular emphasis on high-order and fast methods for the method of moments.

work.name: Politecnico di Torino
work.summary: Conducting research on novel computational electromagnetics numerical methods, focusing on fast, preconditioned, and high-order methods for integral equations.
highlights: Supervising interns and providing assistance to PhD students.
Contributing to the maintenance and management of servers utilized for computer simulations.

work.name: Politecnico di Torino
work.summary: Dissertation title: High Order Technologies in Boundary Element Methods: Analyses, Algorithms, Applications

work.name: Dassault Systemes
work.summary: Internship to explore the application of reinforcement learning for manufacturing applications.
highlights: Implemented a data-driven controller based on reinforcement learning for robotic bin-picking within the PyBullet simulator.
Organized events >10 team building among members.

education.area: Dissertation title: High Order Technologies in Boundary Element Methods: Analyses, Algorithms, Applications
Prominent Coursework: Machine learning, Computer architectures, Database, System programming, Software Engineering and related topics.
Prominent Coursework: Machine Learning, Statistics, Optimization, Database, Deep learning and related topics.
education.studyType: MSc degree in Data Science and Engineering

education.area: Prominent Coursework: Algorithms, Signal processing, OOP, Maths and Electronics.

awards.title: Erasmus Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship for the MSc double-degree at Politecnico di Torino and Telecom Paris.

awards.title: Member of the Mu-Nu chapter of Eta Kappa Nu
awards.awarder: Mu Nu Chapter of Eta Kappa Nu

awards.title: Italian Olympics of astronomy 2013

skills.name: Libraries and Framework
keywords: PETSc (Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation)

projects.name: open321
projects.summary: Developed an open source library providing efficient tools to stabilize and manipulate discrete electromagnetic integral equations
highlights: Providing low and very low frequency regularization techniques relying on quasi-Helmholtz projectors
Compatible with fast iterative and fast direct methods.
